alert.note: Alert for Boone; Northwest Fayette; Northwest Raleigh; Southeast Fayette; Southeast Nicholas; Southeast Raleigh; Wyoming (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 22 at 9:33PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Raleigh, northeastern Wyoming, southern Fayette and southern Boone Counties through 1000 PM EDT... At 933 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Shady Spring, or 7 miles southeast of Beckley, moving southeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Beckley, Fayetteville, Rainelle, Babcock State Park, Oak Hill, Mullens, Mount Hope, Mabscott, Oceana, Sophia, Crab Orchard, Dry Creek, Macarthur, Bradley, Shady Spring, Beaver, Piney View, Stanaford, Coal City and Prosperity. This includes the following highways... West Virginia Turnpike between mile markers 28 and 57. Interstate 64 in West Virginia between mile markers 120 and 137. Route 19 between mile markers 1 and 15. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight EDT for central, southern and southeastern West Virginia.

area.areaDesc: Boone; Northwest Fayette; Northwest Raleigh; Southeast Fayette; Southeast Nicholas; Southeast Raleigh; Wyoming
